plugins.name: q2-amrfinderplus
plugins.description: q2-amrfinderplus: QIIME 2 plugin to find acquired antimicrobial resistance genes and point mutations in protein and/or assembled nucleotide sequences with AMRFinderPlus.

plugins.name: genome-sampler
plugins.description: genome-sampler: sample viral genomes across time of isolation, location of isolation, and genome divergence.

plugins.description: q2-fmt is an all-in-one suite for assessing engraftment extent following Fecal Microbiota Transplants!

plugins.name: q2-annotate
plugins.description: QIIME 2 plugin for functional annotation and taxonomic classification of shotgun metagenomes.

plugins.name: q2-metnet
plugins.description: QIIME 2 plugin to contextualize taxonomic abundance data into high-quality metabolic reconstruction of the human gut microbiota

books.title: Using QIIME 2
books.description: Your guide to becoming a QIIME 2 Framework power user.

books.title: Developing with QIIME 2
books.description: Your guide for writing, testing, and distributing QIIME 2 plugins, interfaces, and documentation.

videos.title: Building a first QIIME 2 plugin
videos.description: A walk-through of creating a new QIIME 2 plugin from a template, and an introduction to the *Developing with QIIME 2* online book (develop.qiime2.org).

videos.title: Expanding the impact of your microbiome study through metadata standardization
videos.description: This video by Chloe Herman was made in collaboration with the National Microbiome Data Collaborative (NMDC). The NMDC's mission is to provide a gateway to Findable Accessible Interoperable and Reusable (FAIR) multi-omics microbiome data by leveraging best practices for data curation and processing. For more information and community discussion check out the related QIIME2 Forum post: https://forum.qiime2.org/t/expand-the-impact-of-your-microbiome-data-through-metadata-standardization/23845

videos.title: Provenance replay demo (alpha software release)
videos.description:
A video introduction to Provenance Replay, software that supports scientific reproducibility, attribution, and collaboration on the QIIME 2 platform.

Provenance Replay (AKA `provenance_lib`) parses the computational history (or "provenance") of QIIME 2 Results, letting you:
* generate executable scripts for your preferred QIIME 2 interface, allowing users to "replay" prior analyses
* report all citations from a QIIME 2 analysis, so creating your reference section is easy
* produce reproducibility supplements for publication or collaboration, supporting the reproducibility of your QIIME 2 analyses

`provenance_lib` is available in alpha release on the QIIME 2 Library at https://library.qiime2.org/plugins/provenance_lib/43/

A tutorial, including instructions for getting help with Provenance Replay, can be found on the QIIME 2 forum at: https://forum.qiime2.org/t/provenance-replay-alpha-release-and-tutorial/23279

videos.title: Machine learning in bioinformatics (part 2)
videos.description:
This lecture goes more in-depth on unsupervised learning, including a worked-example of polar ordination applied to an example human microbiome data set. The slides for this lecture are available at: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/e/2PACX-1vTRMcgTspHpHZuzHvRIZtl9hnHuaA_FmDFskIJPIPQQOCuLpbcGugM4QfsDD8NA_uMQ9l2KEnUpRyXI/pub?start=false&loop=false&delayms=3000

The notes in this video can be found at: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rArohwObOeVhAwO4hwLcyro9oqcPmCxy/view?usp=sharing
